drinksjs.address: 10929 W Pico Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90064
drinksjs.name: The Wellesbourne

speakers.title: Code without Keywords
speakers.name: Sam L'ecuyer
speakers.description: Let's explore math without numeric literals, data without vars, and high order functions as primitives.  Basically, let's talk Church Encoding and build real programs that don't use any construct except => functions.

speakers.title: Destroyer of the Monolith APIs
speakers.name: David Slone
speakers.description: Falcor is a framework that utilizes JSON Graph a new convention for modeling graph data. JSON Graph allows delivery an entire graph object in a very simple javascript object that allows Falcor to return data from multiple microservices simultaneously. This talk will cover the basics of JSON Graph beginning with making your first client side request to understanding the data being returned from a Falcor Router and how to create routes in Falcor router that return data from multiple microservices in a single request.

drinksjs.name: The Independence
drinksjs.misc: The are many paid parking structures in the area

speakers.title: Secure Coding with Node.js
speakers.name: Seth Law
speakers.description: As we all knew it would, JavaScript has finally overtaken the server. This departure from the client to the server introduces a number of security issues and problems that the language does not handle by default. This talk will cover and demonstrate prevalent security vulnerabilities in Node.js applications. In addition, it will address existing security controls within JavaScript code through the use of an intentionally vulnerable Node.js application.

speakers.title: The sad, strange tale of the boy with only two fingers OR an introduction to how binary is used to make websites
speakers.name: Mims H. Wright
speakers.description: Most people know that computers are "just a bunch of ones and zeroes," but few understand what that really means. How do ones and zeros become numbers, words, and pictures? This talk starts at the beginning, explaining binary numbers and shows how they are used to describe basic datatypes. We begin to uncover what the statement "just a bunch of ones and zeroes" really means.

speakers.title: Bringing Open-Source Practices to Your Day Job
speakers.name: Ben Coe
speakers.description: npm has built a community that allows millions of JavaScript developers to build together on a daily basis. From this community great software development practices have emerged: unit-testing, test-coverage, modularity. In this talk Ben will discuss how, and why, you should bring these practices to work with you.

speakers.title: Crashing the Mobile Party
speakers.name: Brian Satorius
speakers.description: Native Apps vs. Hybrid vs. Mobile Web. Can a single Javascript codebase be your cross-platform strategy with today’s tools? Learn through the pitfalls and successes we’ve had at PartyOn, the social music app that uses geolocation, web sockets, and music streaming to improve parties

speakers.title: Reactive Programming for Couch Potatoes
speakers.name: Andrew Hao
speakers.description: You've heard the hype about functional reactive programming and how it's the bee's knees. But... you can't figure out how it works, and all the math-talk and theory jargon that surround the subject are confusing to you.

speakers.title: High performance apps with DoneJS
speakers.name: Justin Meyer
speakers.description: This sentence is wasting your time before you get to useful information. How annoying is that? Annoyed is how your users feel if they can’t see their content immediately while too much JavaScript and CSS downloads too slowly.

host.name: UCLA
host.misc: It will be in the Boelter Hall Room 3400

speakers.title: Getting Started with React Native
speakers.name: Scott Motte
speakers.description: Module of the Month: React Native

speakers.title: Rendering with React
speakers.name: Michael Jackson
speakers.description: The virtual DOM abstraction created by React.js has changed the way the entire industry thinks about rendering web sites. Let's talk about what makes it special, and the cool stuff we can do with it!

speakers.title: Scalable Authentication for Microservices and Single Page Apps
speakers.name: David Guttman
speakers.description: Back in the dark ages of 2015, setting up authentication for microservices and SPAs was a huge PITA. Thankfully, it's now 2016 and it's dead simple. We'll go over what's needed for modern authentication and how easy it is to get it all working with Authentic.
